text.p: These are some of the leading stories in Syrian newspapers on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Syria-France summit in Damascus; leaders agree to promote multi-sided cooperation and work together for just and comprehensive peace.
- Syrian President Hafez al-Assad says French president Jacques Chirac succeeded in his mission of reviving peace process. Chirac says that no peace is possible if agreements are not honoured.
- Israel rejects any European role in the peace process, saying Europe should provide economic aid only.
- Syrian and French businessmen discuss economic cooperation.
- Syrian parliament speaker Abdul-Qadir Qaddoura discusses Arab developments with a visiting Egyptian parliamentary delegation.
- Syrian Foreign Minister Farouq al-Shara and French counterpart Herve de Charette sign agreements to revive scientific and cultural cooperation.
